guide.introduction: At Maker Faire, we teach folks to solder for $1 in the Maker Shed store. What do you get for $1? Not much these days! Well, that's just not the case here. For just $1, you get expert advice on how to solder and a really cool electronic skill badge!
guide.introduction_rendered:
At Maker Faire, we teach folks to solder for $1 in the Maker Shed store. What do you get for $1? Not much these days! Well, that's just not the case here. For just $1, you get expert advice on how to solder and a really cool electronic skill badge!

Relevant parts
  • Learn-to-Solder Skill Badge Kit
Tools
  • Rosin-core solder
  • Soldering iron
  • Wire cutters

lines.text: Check your kit's contents. You should have:
lines.text_raw: Check your kit's contents. You should have:

lines.text: Printed circuit board
lines.text_raw: Printed circuit board

lines.text: Rainbow LED
lines.text_raw: Rainbow LED

lines.text: Battery holder
lines.text_raw: Battery holder

lines.text: 3V CR1220 battery
lines.text_raw: 3V CR1220 battery

lines.text: Tie-tack pin
lines.text_raw: Tie-tack pin

lines.text: Tie-tack clutch
lines.text_raw: Tie-tack clutch

lines.text: Start by adding a "blob" of solder to the battery pad on the back. Just a little will help the battery stay snug in the holder.
lines.text_raw: Start by adding a "blob" of solder to the battery pad on the back. Just a little will help the battery stay snug in the holder.

lines.text: Next, place the battery holder in the printed circuit board (PCB). It goes on the back of the PCB, and is oriented according to the silk screen on the board.
lines.text_raw: Next, place the battery holder in the printed circuit board (PCB). It goes on the back of the PCB, and is oriented according to the silk screen on the board.

lines.text: Now you can solder the battery holder from the front of the pin. Flip it over, and place it on a flat surface.
lines.text_raw: Now you can solder the battery holder from the front of the pin. Flip it over, and place it on a flat surface.

lines.text: Now heat up the pins of the battery holder with your soldering iron and solder it in place.
lines.text_raw: Now heat up the pins of the battery holder with your soldering iron and solder it in place.

lines.text: Next solder in the tie-tack pin.
lines.text_raw: Next solder in the tie-tack pin.

lines.text: Place the pin though the hole in the front of the PCB. It will not fall through the hole; just let it go!
lines.text_raw: Place the pin though the hole in the front of the PCB. It will not fall through the hole; just let it go!

lines.text: Now apply heat to the pin from the back,  and solder it into place.
lines.text_raw: Now apply heat to the pin from the back,  and solder it into place.

lines.text: Now add the light-emitting diode (LED).
lines.text_raw: Now add the light-emitting diode (LED).

lines.text: First, note which wire lead is longer on the LED. This wire is the anode, or positive (+), lead and will eventually be inserted into the hole marked (+) on the PCB.
lines.text_raw: First, note which wire lead is longer on the LED. This wire is the anode, or positive (+), lead and will eventually be inserted into the hole marked (+) on the PCB.

lines.text: The shorter lead on the LED is the cathode, or (-), lead. This is placed in the (-) hole on the PCB.
lines.text_raw: The shorter lead on the LED is the cathode, or (-), lead. This is placed in the (-) hole on the PCB.

lines.text: Now that you have identified the (+) and (-) leads, hold the LED so it is oriented correctly on the board and bend the leads 90° down towards the board.
lines.text_raw: Now that you have identified the (+) and (-) leads, hold the LED so it is oriented correctly on the board and bend the leads 90° down towards the board.

lines.text: Now you can insert the LED into the PCB. It should sit flat against it.
lines.text_raw: Now you can insert the LED into the PCB. It should sit flat against it.

lines.text: Flip the board over, and spread the leads apart. This will keep the LED in place
lines.text_raw: Flip the board over, and spread the leads apart. This will keep the LED in place

lines.text: Solder the LED in place.
lines.text_raw: Solder the LED in place.

lines.text: Finish it up!
lines.text_raw: Finish it up!

lines.text: Now all you have to do is insert the battery.
lines.text_raw: Now all you have to do is insert the battery.

lines.text: Make sure the (+) side of the battery is facing up.
lines.text_raw: Make sure the (+) side of the battery is facing up.

lines.text: Now you can pin it to your bag, hat, or whatever and show off your soldering skills!
lines.text_raw: Now you can pin it to your bag, hat, or whatever and show off your soldering skills!

guide.summary: Learning to solder has never been so easy.
